                                     java.lang.String keyOutDirectory)

        Parameters:

        testNumber - student ID
        templateDirectory - directory where XML template is located
        outDirectory - directory to put output
        formOutDirectory - directory to put student entering forms
        keyOutDirectory - directory to put answer keys

public static void gradeTest(java.lang.String key,
                                          java.lang.String toGrade)

        Grades a plaintext test, given a key. Outputs to "grades.csv".

        toGrade - the student's answer file.

                                          java.lang.String outFile)
        Deprecated. use gradeForm(String, String) instead.
        Grades a plaintext test, given a key. Outputs to the given CSV file.
        Parameters:
        key - the answer key file.
        toGrade - the student's answer file.
        outFile - the csv to output files to

      • gradeForm

        public static void gradeForm(java.lang.String toGrade,
                             java.lang.String outFile)
        Grades a generated form, where key is given as either filename or in StudentID field. Outputs to the given CSV file.
        Parameters:
        toGrade - the student's test to grade. Assumes the key file is of format "key"+studentID+".txt".
        outFile - the output CSV to display grades.

      • gradeForm

        public static void gradeForm(java.lang.String toGrade,
                             java.lang.String outFile,
                             java.lang.String studentDir,
                             java.lang.String keyDir,
                             java.lang.String CSVDir)
        grades a student's test.
        Parameters:
        toGrade - student test filename
        outFile - output csv for grade data
        studentDir - directory where student test is located
        keyDir - directory where answer key is
        CSVDir - directory where to put csv

      • genTestFromXML

        public static void genTestFromXML(java.lang.String template,
                                  int testNumber)
        Generate a plaintext test from xml. Use when space is an issue, but otherwise the PDF looks nicer.
        Parameters:
        template - xml template for test
        testNumber - student id

      • generatePDFTests

        public static void generatePDFTests(java.lang.String template,
                                    java.lang.String templateDir,
                                    java.lang.String outKeyDir,
                                    java.lang.String outTestDir,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> ids)
        generate tests for student ids with more customizability
        Parameters:
        template - name of plaintext test template
        templateDir - directory where test template is
        outKeyDir - directory where to put answer key
        outTestDir - directory where to put test + student form
        ids - arraylist of student ids

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Parameters:
        args: - arguments. make: interactively generate a test. generate: generate tests for students, given the template and student id list. Will make an intermediate XML file. grade: grades the tests, given a student answers directory and a key directory.
